summary: Tweaks and balancing to Skyrim\'s various \"blessings\", making them worth acquiring and useful for gameplay.
descriptionHtml:
[b][i]REQUIRES DRAGONBORN AND DAWNGUARD DLCS[/i][/b]

Tweaks and balancing to Skyrim\'s various \"blessings\", making them worth acquiring and useful for gameplay. By default, most of the blessings you get from shrines are near useless and does not impact gameplay enough to worth using. The amulets in particular, which are quickly replaced early in the game just by enchanting rings and necklaces with better stats. The purpose of this mod is to fix that issue, especially for roleplayers such as myself that like having their characters act according to lore for immersion, but don\'t like the gameplay suffering from doing so. I try to make the blessing more powerful, but not to the point where it becomes overpowered. Also, they have been modified to fit the image of the deities based on the lore of the games. The changes were designed to be played in higher difficulties or for those that have difficulty and gameplay mods. I\'ve also removed the shrines\' ability to cure diseases for balancing purposes.

[b][i]Update: NEW BLESSING TWEAKS FOR DAWNGUARD AND DRAGONBORN DLC:[/i][/b]

[b]BLESSING OF AURIEL:[/b]
Fortify Archery by 20%
Restoration spells are 10% stronger during the day

[b]BLESSING OF AZURA:[/b]
Resist magic by 15% (20% if player has Azura\'s Star) (25% if player is Dunmer)
Fortify Magicka regeneration by 15% (20% if player has Azura\'s Star) (25% if player is Dunmer)

[b]BLESSING OF BOETHIAH[/b]
Fortify One-Handed by 15% (20% if player has completed Boethiah\'s Calling) (25% if player is Dunmer)
Fortify Heavy Armor by 15% (20% if player has completed Boethiah\'s Calling) (25% if player is Dunmer)

[b]BLESSING OF MEPHALA:[/b]
Prices are 10% better (15% if player has completed The Whispering Door) (20% if player is Dunmer)
Sneaking is better by 5% (10% if player has completed The Whispering Door) (15% if player is Dunmer)

[b]BLESSING OF AKATOSH:[/b] 
Fortify Health, Magicka, and Stamina by 20 points
Fortify Health, Magicka, and Stamina regeneration by 20%

[b]BLESSING OF ARKAY:[/b]
Fortify Health by 50 points
Health regenerates twice as fast when near death

[b]BLESSING OF DIBELLA:[/b]
Fortify Speech by 25 points (50 points if player is female)

[b]BLESSING OF JULIANOS:[/b]
Fortify Magicka by 50 points
Spells in all schools are 10% stronger
Resist magic by 50% when near full health

[b]BLESSING OF KYNARETH:[/b]
Fortify Stamina by 50 points
Resist Poison and Disease by 50% when player is equal or above 50% Health
Fortify Stamina regeneration by 50% when player is equal or below 20% Health

[b]BLESSINGS OF MARA:[/b]
Fortify Restoration magic by 30% (50% if used on an ally)
All skills increase faster by 10%

[b]BLESSINGS OF STENDARR:[/b]
Fortify Block by 20%
Fortify Light and Heavy Armor by 10%
Resist 10% physical damage when player is equal or below 25% Health

[b]BLESSING OF TALOS:[/b]
Shout cooldown is reduced by 30%
Weapons are 5% stronger

[b]BLESSING OF ZENITHAR:[/b]
Prices are better by 20%
Fortify Smithing skill by 10%
Fortify Alchemy by 10%
Carry Weight increases by 20 points (40 points if player is in full health)

[b]BLESSING OF NOCTURNAL:[/b]
Sneaking is better by 15%
Illusion spells cost 10% less to cast at night
Prices are 10% better

[i]As for the amulets, they\'re about at half the strength of the shrine blessings. Equip them along with the shrine blessings to show your faith and have the blessings at 1.5 times their power![/i]

[b]=== INSTALLATION ===[/b]
Use any mod manager like NMM or just manually extract the files into Skyrim\'s Data folder. If you manual installed, don\'t forget to tick/activate the esp before starting the game. Although unnecessary, if you really want to be safe, remove any amulets or wait until the blessing wear off from your character.

[b]=== UPDATING ===[/b]
Use NMM or just replace the old file with the new one.

[b]=== UNINSTALLATION ===[/b]
Remove or delete Blessed.esp and as with installation instructions, unequip any amulets and/or wait until your blessings wear off to be safe.

[b]=== LOAD ORDER ===[/b]
Anywhere will work.

[b]=== COMPATIBILITY ===[/b]
Not compatible with anything that changes the same thing (obviously). This mod also does not use any scripts.

[b]=== ISSUES ===[/b]
The effects description in the game\'s UI may not be the same as what the blessings really do. For now I don\'t know how to get around this, since the game sometimes automatically creates the effects description of every equippable item. I will try fix it once i find a way to work around this issue.

[b]=== FUTURE PLANS ===[/b]
Tweaking other blessings from other deities too, including the ones from the DLCs or various quests in the game.
author: Nofumasa

files.name: Blessed - Blessings Rebalanced
files.changelogHtml:
Added Dragonborn and Dawnguard DLC support
Redone conditional blessings from scratch
Nocturnal Blessing added
